protocol_name: Phenol/chloroform extraction of DNA from cyanobacteria
protocol_name_html: Phenol/chloroform extraction of DNA from cyanobacteria
description: Phenol/chloroform-based DNA extraction from cells pre-treated with RNase A, lysozyme, proteinase K, and SDS. The protocol was optimized for extracting DNA from Microcystis aeruginosa, but works well for other cyanobacteria.

groups.group_name: The Aquatic Microbial Ecology Research Group - AMERG (The Buchan, Zinser and Wilhelm labs)

status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

components.data: Phenol/chloroform extraction
components.name: Section

components.data: Transfer aqueous (top) layer to clean eppendorf tube without removing any of the organic layer. Remove the last of the aqueous layer along with some of the organic layer (to ensure all aqueous volume is collected) to a second clean tube for later re-extraction. This re-extraction will significantly increase DNA recovery.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer aqueous (top) layer to clean eppendorf tube without removing any of the organic layer. Remove the last of the aqueous layer along with some of the organic layer (to ensure all aqueous volume is collected) to a second clean tube for later re-extraction. This re-extraction will significantly increase DNA recovery.

components.data: Pre-treatment of cells with RNase A, lysozyme, proteinase K, and SDS
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Pre-treatment of cells with RNase A, lysozyme, proteinase K, and SDS

components.data: Add 25 µL of 100 mg/mL lysozyme for a final concentration of 5 mg/mL lysozyme.  Incubate at 37 °C for 20 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 25 µL of 100 mg/mL lysozyme for a final concentration of 5 mg/mL lysozyme.  Incubate at 37 °C for 20 min.

components.data: Phenol/chloroform extraction
components.name: Section

components.data: Repeat steps 7 and 8 twice (a total of 3 phenol extractions) or until no visible protein layer is seen. Protein layer will be white scum at interface.  Each time, remove the last of the aqueous layer along with some of the organic layer to the 're-extraction' eppendorf tube (refer to step 9).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Repeat steps 7 and 8 twice (a total of 3 phenol extractions) or until no visible protein layer is seen. Protein layer will be white scum at interface.  Each time, remove the last of the aqueous layer along with some of the organic layer to the 're-extraction' eppendorf tube (refer to step 9).

components.data: Pre-treatment of cells with RNase A, lysozyme, proteinase K, and SDS
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Pre-treatment of cells with RNase A, lysozyme, proteinase K, and SDS

components.data: Add 50 µL of 100 µg/mL RNase A TER buffer (RNase A plus TE buffer) for a final concentration of 10 µg/mL RNase A.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 50 µL of 100 µg/mL RNase A TER buffer (RNase A plus TE buffer) for a final concentration of 10 µg/mL RNase A.

components.data: Pre-treatment of cells with RNase A, lysozyme, proteinase K, and SDS
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Pre-treatment of cells with RNase A, lysozyme, proteinase K, and SDS

components.data: Re-suspend pellet in 425 µL of standard TE buffer (10 mM Tris, 1 mM EDTA, pH 8).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Re-suspend pellet in 425 µL of standard TE buffer (10 mM Tris, 1 mM EDTA, pH 8).

components.data: Phenol/chloroform extraction
components.name: Section

components.data: Add 250 mL chloroform/isoamyl alcohol (24:1), gently but thoroughly mix.  Spin at maximum in a benchtop centrifuge for at least 2 minutes.  Longer spin times (up to 10 min.) may help in separating the phases.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 250 mL chloroform/isoamyl alcohol (24:1), gently but thoroughly mix.  Spin at maximum in a benchtop centrifuge for at least 2 minutes.  Longer spin times (up to 10 min.) may help in separating the phases.

components.data: Phenol/chloroform extraction
components.name: Section

components.data: Add 250 mL phenol (pH 8.0), gently but thoroughly mix.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 250 mL phenol (pH 8.0), gently but thoroughly mix.

components.data: Pre-treatment of cells with RNase A, lysozyme, proteinase K, and SDS
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Pre-treatment of cells with RNase A, lysozyme, proteinase K, and SDS

components.data: Add 50 µL of 10% sodium dodecyl sulfate.  Incubate at 50 °C for 2 hr.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 50 µL of 10% sodium dodecyl sulfate.  Incubate at 50 °C for 2 hr.

components.data: Pre-treatment of cells with RNase A, lysozyme, proteinase K, and SDS
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Pre-treatment of cells with RNase A, lysozyme, proteinase K, and SDS

components.data: Add 50 µL of 1 mg/mL proteinase K for a final concentration of 100 µg/mL proteinase K.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 50 µL of 1 mg/mL proteinase K for a final concentration of 100 µg/mL proteinase K.

components.data: Phenol/chloroform extraction
components.name: Section

components.data: Repeat steps 11 and 12 to remove all phenol.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Repeat steps 11 and 12 to remove all phenol.

components.data: Phenol/chloroform extraction
components.name: Section

components.data: Transfer aqueous (top) layer to clean eppendorf tube without removing any of the organic layer.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer aqueous (top) layer to clean eppendorf tube without removing any of the organic layer.

components.data: Phenol/chloroform extraction
components.name: Section

components.data: Add 500 µL of chloroform and gently mix.  Spin at maximum in a benchtop centrifuge for at least 2 minutes. (This will help remove traces of phenol.)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 500 µL of chloroform and gently mix.  Spin at maximum in a benchtop centrifuge for at least 2 minutes. (This will help remove traces of phenol.)

components.data: Ethanol precipitation
components.name: Section

components.data: Add 0.1 volume of 3 M sodium acetate to the collected aqueous phase and gently mix.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 0.1 volume of 3 M sodium acetate to the collected aqueous phase and gently mix.

components.data: Phenol/chloroform extraction
components.name: Section

components.data: Extract the mixed aqueous/organic contents of the "re-extraction" eppendorf tube following steps 7-13.  Combine the final aqueous layer with that collected above.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Extract the mixed aqueous/organic contents of the "re-extraction" eppendorf tube following steps 7-13.  Combine the final aqueous layer with that collected above.

components.data: Ethanol precipitation
components.name: Section

components.data: Add 2 volumes of ice cold 100% ethanol and gently mix well.  Strings of precipitating DNA should become visible.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 2 volumes of ice cold 100% ethanol and gently mix well.  Strings of precipitating DNA should become visible.

components.data: Ethanol precipitation
components.name: Section

components.data: Place tube in -80 °C freezer until ethanol mixture is partially frozen (~1 hr.)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place tube in -80 °C freezer until ethanol mixture is partially frozen (~1 hr.)

components.data: Ethanol precipitation
components.name: Section

components.data: Spin at maximum in a benchtop centrifuge at 4 °C for 30 min.  Discard supernatant and very carefully aspirate the remaining droplets of liquid from the tube without disrupting the DNA pellet.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Spin at maximum in a benchtop centrifuge at 4 °C for 30 min.  Discard supernatant and very carefully aspirate the remaining droplets of liquid from the tube without disrupting the DNA pellet.

components.data: Ethanol precipitation
components.name: Section

components.data: Wash the DNA pellet by adding 500 µL of ice-cold 70% ethanol to the tube and pipetting gently several times.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash the DNA pellet by adding 500 µL of ice-cold 70% ethanol to the tube and pipetting gently several times.

components.data: Ethanol precipitation
components.name: Section

components.data: Spin at maximum in a benchtop centrifuge at 4 °C for 15 min.  Discard supernatant and carefully aspirate the remaining droplets of liquid from the tube without disrupting the DNA pellet.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Spin at maximum in a benchtop centrifuge at 4 °C for 15 min.  Discard supernatant and carefully aspirate the remaining droplets of liquid from the tube without disrupting the DNA pellet.

components.data: Ethanol precipitation
components.name: Section

components.data: Place in a heater block at ~37 °C for less than 5 minutes to evaporate all ethanol.  Be careful! DO NOT dry to completion!  Alternatively, you can air dry to remove the ethanol.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place in a heater block at ~37 °C for less than 5 minutes to evaporate all ethanol.  Be careful! DO NOT dry to completion!  Alternatively, you can air dry to remove the ethanol.

components.data: Ethanol precipitation
components.name: Section

components.data: Re-suspend the DNA pellet in 50-100 µL of TE buffer or water (depending on downstream use and needed concentration).  Freeze at -20 or -80 °C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Re-suspend the DNA pellet in 50-100 µL of TE buffer or water (depending on downstream use and needed concentration).  Freeze at -20 or -80 °C.

components.data: Pre-treatment of cells with RNase A, lysozyme, proteinase K, and SDS
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Pre-treatment of cells with RNase A, lysozyme, proteinase K, and SDS

components.data: Concentrate ~4 mL of cell culture in an eppendorf tube by centrifuging at 10,000 xg for ~5 min.  Discard supernatant.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Concentrate ~4 mL of cell culture in an eppendorf tube by centrifuging at 10,000 xg for ~5 min.  Discard supernatant.
